title: Honda City gets Apex Edition kit for Rs 25,000
description: Honda has launched a new Apex Edition kit for the City sedan, which is an accessory package available on the mid-spec V and VX trims. The package brings some exterior and interior cosmetic enhancements, and is priced at Rs 25,000. The Apex Edition kit will be available in limited volumes, and can be availed as a dealer-level accessory. City gets new Apex Edition badges on fenders and boot lid Interior gets leatherette finish for dashboard and door pads Only available on V and VX trims Honda City Apex edition: what’s new? Exterior updates are limited to just Apex Edition badges on the front fenders and on the boot lid. The upgrades are more significant on the interior where it gets a leatherette finish for the dashboard, the door pads and the centre console area. It also gets Apex Edition-exclusive seat covers and cushions. This kit also brings 7-colour ambient lighting around the instrument panel and in the door pockets. Interestingly, the ambient lighting package can also be availed as an individual accessory for Rs 7,500 on any of the four trims (SV, V, VX and ZX). The Honda City continues with its 121hp, 1.5-litre naturally aspirated petrol engine that can be had with either a 6-speed manual or a 7-step CVT gearbox. The mid-spec City V trim is priced at Rs 12.70 lakh, while the CVT is priced at Rs 13.95 lakh. Similarly, the VX manual and CVT variants are priced at Rs 13.82 lakh and Rs 15.07 lakh, respectively. The Apex Edition kit will be an additional Rs 25,000 over this. Also See: Honda Elevate Apex Edition launched at Rs 12.86 lakh

html:
The City Apex Edition kit will have limited availability.

Honda has launched a new Apex Edition kit for the City sedan, which is an accessory package available on the mid-spec V and VX trims. The package brings some exterior and interior cosmetic enhancements, and is priced at Rs 25,000. The Apex Edition kit will be available in limited volumes, and can be availed as a dealer-level accessory.

  1. City gets new Apex Edition badges on fenders and boot lid
  2. Interior gets leatherette finish for dashboard and door pads
  3. Only available on V and VX trims

Honda City Apex edition: what’s new?

Exterior updates are limited to just Apex Edition badges on the front fenders and on the boot lid. The upgrades are more significant on the interior where it gets a leatherette finish for the dashboard, the door pads and the centre console area. It also gets Apex Edition-exclusive seat covers and cushions.

This kit also brings 7-colour ambient lighting around the instrument panel and in the door pockets. Interestingly, the ambient lighting package can also be availed as an individual accessory for Rs 7,500 on any of the four trims (SV, V, VX and ZX).

The Honda City continues with its 121hp, 1.5-litre naturally aspirated petrol engine that can be had with either a 6-speed manual or a 7-step CVT gearbox. The mid-spec City V trim is priced at Rs 12.70 lakh, while the CVT is priced at Rs 13.95 lakh. Similarly, the VX manual and CVT variants are priced at Rs 13.82 lakh and Rs 15.07 lakh, respectively. The Apex Edition kit will be an additional Rs 25,000 over this.
